required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Tachosil® for Lymph Sealing During Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Tachosil® for Lymph Sealing During Surgery. A Non-Interventional Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe effectiveness and reliability of TachoSil® in lymph sealing after lymphadenectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this non-interventional study (NIS) was to collect further knowledge on the routine use of TachoSil ® in lymph node surgery where its sealing property helps to reduce the rate of postoperative complications, especially of seroma formation. Some data are already available from gynecology, urology and thoracic surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Post-Operative Seroma Formation Over Time as Determined at Hospital Discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of TachoSil® by the Surgeon With Respect to Handling Using a 10-Point Numerical Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The surgeon evaluated handling of TachoSil® using a 10-point scale where: 1=very good to 10=very poor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of TachoSil® by the Surgeon With Respect to Utility in Operation Using a 10-Point Numerical Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The surgeon evaluated Utility in Operation of TachoSil® using a 10-point scale where: 1=very useful to 10=completely useless.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of TachoSil® by the Surgeon With Respect to Satisfaction Using a 10-Point Numerical Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The surgeon evaluated Satisfaction in Operation of TachoSil® using a 10-point scale where: 1=very satisfied to 10=totally unsatisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One Drainage Inserted
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of participants where at least one drainage was used during the operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Change in Length of Drainage Stay and Drainage Volume
Length of Hospital and ICU Stay
secondary_outcome.description: Length of stay includes time (days) spent in the intensive care unit (ICU) and normal hospital station.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pharmacoeconomic Benefit Based on Savings of Operating Time
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacoeconomic benefit was assessed by the surgeon based on savings/shortening of operating time in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pharmacoeconomic Benefit Based on Shortening of Hospital Stay
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacoeconomic benefit was assessed by the surgeon at hospital discharge based on shortening of hospital stay in days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pharmacoeconomic Benefit in Shortening of Time Spent in ICU
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacoeconomic benefit was assessed by the surgeon at hospital discharge based on shortening of time spent in ICU in days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pharmacoeconomic Benefit Based on Drainage Time Reduced
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacoeconomic evaluation as assessed by the surgeon at hospital discharge based on drainage time reduced in days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pharmacoeconomic Benefit Based on Drainage Volume Reduced
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacoeconomic benefit was assessed by the surgeon at hospital discharge based on the drainage volume reduced in milliliters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Post-Operative Complications and Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a drug; it does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (eg, a clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a drug, whether or not it is considered related to the drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) is defined as an adverse event with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.

arm_group.description: TachoSil®, sterile absorbable patch, topical application, used during surgery in participants who had lymphadenectomy according to the Summary of Product Characteristics.

intervention.description: TachoSil® is a collagen sponge that is coated with the active substances human fibrinogen and human thrombin and that supports hemostasis and tissue sealing in surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Stationary patients in whom a lymph node resection was planned to be performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stationary patients undergoing lymph node resection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications, such as hypersensitivity to the active pharmaceutical ingredient or to another ingredient.

overall_official.affiliation: Takeda Pharma Vertrieb GmbH & Co. KG

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 39 investigative sites in Germany from 30 September 2012 to 27 March 2014.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Collection of information of routine use of TachoSil® in participants who had lymph node surgery.

group.title: TachoSil®
group.description: TachoSil®, sterile absorbable patch, topical application, applied during surgery in participants who had lymph node surgery according to the Summary of Product Characteristics.

baseline.population: ITT population consisted of all patients who received patient information and who consented to the collection, transmission and evaluation of their data and who underwent lymph node resection with TachoSil®.

group.title: TachoSil®
group.description: TachoSil®, sterile absorbable patch, topical application, applied during surgery in participants who had lymph node surgery according to the Summary of Product Characteristics.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Age data was available for 226 participants.

measure.title: Height
measure.description: Height data was available for 216 participants.

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: Weight data was available for 216 participants.

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: BMI data was available for 216 participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Post-Operative Complications and Adverse Events
outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a drug; it does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (eg, a clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a drug, whether or not it is considered related to the drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) is defined as an adverse event with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.
outcome.population: ITT population consisted of all patients who received patient information and consented to the collection, transmission and evaluation of their data and who underwent lymph node resection with TachoSil®.

group.title: TachoSil®
group.description: TachoSil®, sterile absorbable patch, topical application, applied during surgery in participants who had lymph node surgery according to the Summary of Product Characteristics.

An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (eg, a clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a drug, whether or not it is considered related to the drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) is defined as an adverse event with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.
measure.population: ITT population consisted of all patients who received patient information and consented to the collection, transmission and evaluation of their data and who underwent lymph node resection with TachoSil®.

reported_events.desc: At each visit the investigator had to document any occurrence of adverse events and abnormal laboratory findings. Any event spontaneously reported by the participant or observed by the investigator was recorded, irrespective of the relation to study treatment.

group.title: TachoSil®
group.description: TachoSil®, sterile absorbable patch, topical application, applied during surgery in participants who had lymph node surgery according to the Summary of Product Characteristics.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The first study related publication will be a multi-center publication submitted within 24 months after conclusion or termination of a study at all sites. After such multi site publication, all proposed site publications and presentations will be submitted to sponsor for review 60 days in advance of publication. Site will remove Sponsor confidential information unrelated to study results. Sponsor can delay a proposed publication for another 60 days to preserve intellectual property.
